title: Pistyll Rhaeadr Walk Route

images.title: John Firth / Pistyll Rhaeadr
images.caption: Pistyll Rhaeadr. View of the upper section of the falls in the summer. The waterfalls is formed as the Afon Disgynfa falls in three stages over the 240-foot drop.

images.title: Gerald England / Pistyll Rhaeadr 1987
images.caption: The bottom section of the waterfall.

images.title: John Phillips / Pistyll Rhaeadr
images.caption: The Highest Waterfall in Wales. Nearest town Llanrhaeadr-ym-Mochnant

images.title: Eirian Evans / Steep climb to the top of Pistyll Rhaeadr
images.caption: Steep climb to the top of Pistyll Rhaeadr. Steps that lead to the top of the waterfall, zig zagging up the mountainside.

images.title: The tearooms and campsite below Pistyll Rhaeadr by Jeremy Bolwell, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The tearooms and campsite below Pistyll Rhaeadr

images.title: Eirian Evans / Tan y Pistyll Restaurant
images.caption: Tan y Pistyll Restaurant

images.title: Craig-Y- Mwn by moston harratt, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Craig-Y- Mwn Lead Mine. This striking old lead mine is located just to the south of the falls and well worth a visit.

images.title: Pistyll Rhaeadr and car park by Jeremy Bolwell, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The country lane leading to the car park.

description: This circular walk visits a spectacular 240-foot (73 m) waterfall regarded as one of the Seven Wonders of Wales. The walk begins at the car park at the foot of the waterfall and takes you past the falls and then along a footpath running next to the Afon/River Rhaeadr. You return to the start point along a country lane. The falls are surrounded by some beautiful countryside so there's ample opportunity to continue your walk. There is a B&B and a cafe near the falls so you can also refresh yourself after the walk. The challenging climb to Cadair Berwyn also starts from Pistyll Rhaeadr so you could head north along this footpath for great views of the area.
